Summary: Handling the back button in Shell vs NavigationPage. Customize visibility and behavior with BackButtonBehavior (Shell), or override OnBackButtonPressed in a custom ContentPage (NavigationPage).
Remarks: Under Shell, configure the back button via the BackButtonBehavior and attach callbacks with OnBackButtonPressed() directly on the page. You can also control BackButtonIsVisible, BackButtonIsEnabled, BackButtonText and BackButtonIcon. Under NavigationPage, there is no built-in BackButtonPressed event. To intercept back presses, create a Page-derived class and override OnBackButtonPressed(), then scaffold and use it in your component. You can disable the default back button with the NavigationPage.HasBackButton attached property when needed.
